snippet: The Chinese and American presidents’ news conference laid bare stubborn differences over issues like press freedom.
abstract: News analysis; Beijing news conference between Pres Xi Jinping and Pres Obama, during which Xi abandons platitudes to warn Western world not to meddle in China's affairs, provides riveting example of why relationship between United States and China remains one of world's most complicated; countries' determination to work together belies deep-rooted historical grievances and fierce rivalry.

byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Beijing, and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The Chinese and American presidents’ news conference laid bare stubborn differences over issues like press freedom.

headline.main: Fruitful Visit by Obama Ends With a Lecture From Xi
headline.print_headline: Fruitful Visit by Obama Ends With a Lecture From Xi
